basics.name: Mohd Hafizul Afifi bin Abdullah
basics.summary: Specializes in Information Extraction, Predictive Analytics, Big Data Analytics, AI/ML

work.name: Institute for Advanced Study, Princeton University
work.summary: Teaching at Palmer Physical Laboratory (now 302 Frist Campus Center). While not a professor at Princeton, I associated with the physics professors and continued to give lectures on campus.

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

education.institution: Universiti Tun Hussein Onn Malaysia, Johor, Malaysia
Universiti Tun Hussein Onn Malaysia, Johor, Malaysia

awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

publications.name: A comprehensive review of existing corpora and methods for creating annotated corpora for event extraction tasks
publications.summary: This study provides a detailed review of annotated corpora for event extraction, essential for improving related algorithms. It aims to guide researchers in developing accurate annotated corpora, offering structured guidelines and tools for corpus preparation. This review highlights the global applicability of English corpora, serving as a valuable framework for improving annotation quality across diverse domains.

publications.name: Systematic Literature Review of Information Extraction From Textual Data: Recent Methods, Applications, Trends, and Challenges
publications.summary: This study reviews recent advancements in information extraction (IE) techniques, especially for processing textual data. This SLR analyzed 161 recent studies published from 2017 to 2022 provides a focus on core concepts, recent methods, applications, trends, challenges, and future directions in IE from text data. It highlights deep learning models as the state-of-the-art for extracting information from textual sources.

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
